FuncDef: The receive-time command makes a key act as a receive-key for the specified interval of time. The receive-time command makes a key act as a receive-key for the specified interval of time. By default, no receive-time is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the start date of the month to be configured as the receive date for the given key. <startDate>&<1-31> specifies the dates of the month. A maximum of 31 can be configured.
The value ranges from 1 to 31.

Specifies the end receive date of the month.
The value ranges from 2 to 31. The end date should be greater than the start date.

Specifies the date of the month.
-

ExtraInfo: A keychain consists of multiple key IDs and different key IDs are active in different time periods. In this manner, authentication algorithms can be dynamically switched, improving protocol data transmission security. To make different key IDs take effect in different time periods, you need to configure the sending time and receiving time of each key ID.
